@sareg0 As discussed last week, here are some commented screenshots:

Students have a "Status Updates" link up top:

It brings up the listing of the team's recent updates. Choose "New Status Update" to create one:

The form is pretty straightforward:

You can also use simple markdown:

Save and marvel at the front page:

body:
@sareg0 As discussed last week, here are some commented screenshots:

Students have a "Status Updates" link up top:

![status_update_01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/164400/8451554/6d027152-1fe4-11e5-84dc-fb1b7d21424f.png)

---

It brings up the listing of the team's recent updates. Choose "New Status Update" to create one:

![status_update_02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/164400/8451564/7c32bb50-1fe4-11e5-98f3-f9385454bfde.png)

---

The form is pretty straightforward:

![status_update_03-form](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/164400/8451584/9aa45666-1fe4-11e5-8b41-60e3258ee23b.png)

---

You can also use simple markdown:

![status_update_04-markdown](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/164400/8451593/ae0c7170-1fe4-11e5-9d07-590519f6e2cf.png)

---

Save and marvel at the front page:

![status_update_05-frontpagersult](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/164400/8451601/be60627a-1fe4-11e5-9e42-3ce5dc349b8c.png)
